title: Distributed Data Show Ep 88: Application Development with Graph Data with Dr. Denise Gosnell and...
description:
Denise Gosnell interviews Dave Bechberger live at Data Day Texas regarding challenges when developing Graph based applications, recommendations on approaches to take, and what resources are available for developers new to Graph.

Join us at DataStax Accelerate learn how Apache Cassandra and DataStax can help you succeed to building large scale applications. For tickets go to datastax.com/accelerate and use discount code ADVOCATE20. 


00:42 Challenges for application development with Graph
01:21 Performance issues that dev teams run into when issuing Graph "queries"
02:17 What is branching factor?
03:08 Top 3 recommendations when data modeling with Graph
04:30 Debate over edges or vertices, when to use each?
05:25 "Even in the relational world, everyone loves 3rd normal form until it doesn't work"
06:04 Where do development teams gain skills using Graph databases?
07:21 What kind of resources are recommended when learning gremlin query languages?
08:32 Dave's releasing a new book "Graph Databases in Action"
09:29 Advice on building Graph based applications for production

ABOUT DATASTAX ENTERPRISE 6
DataStax  powers  the  Right-Now  Enterprise  with  the  always-on,  distributed  cloud  database  built  on  Apache  Cassandraâ„¢  and designed for hybrid cloud. DataStax Enterprise 6 (DSE 6) includes industry-leading performance, self-driving operational simplicity, and robust analytics.

Learn more at http://www.datastax.com/products/datastax-enterprise and https://www.datastax.com/products/datastax-enterprise-6

CONNECT WITH DATASTAX
Subscribe: http://www.youtube.com/c/datastax?sub_confirmation=1 
Site: http://datastax.com 
Facebook: https://facebook.com/datastax 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/datastax | https://twitter.com/datastax-academy
Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/company/datastax
http://feeds.feedburner.com/datastax 
https://github.com/datastax 

ABOUT DATASTAX ACADEMY
On the DataStax Academy YouTube channel, you can find tutorials, webinars and much more to

practice here at data stacks to talk with you all about application development with graph data from data staff this is the distributed data show context we have been talking about this so far and focusing a whole series on application development with challenges and best best practices and so we brought Dave here to get this kicked off and I'm curious to get us started in this discussion for graph data what are some of the application and developer challenges that you have faced and what do you see when you're out there working with development teams I mean I think the most common most common challenges I see with development teams is really a couple couple there's two kind of ways there's really one is about really understanding what how graphs work and and having issues with querying the query patterns that they're using and the data modelling patterns that they're using and the other one just kind of loops back into that as far as like the team skills that they'd have because it's it's a different set of skills to work with graph data than it is with what they're probably used to in a more relational manner yeah yeah so you we see that a lot and you mentioned querying so what what specific performance issues do you commonly see a dev team run into when they're working with a query and maybe before you get into that what do you mean by a graph query well not when I'm talking about a graph query I'm talking about essentially what they use to actually retrieve the data back out of the system or put data in so basically the relational or the graph version of sequel okay and usually what I see people have a problem with is they're not um they don't completely understand what their their query is doing they're running it in ways that they're not filtering out data per freely or at the right time so it ends up taking a very long time to return data because graph data when you're running graph query is they kind of they have this called branching factor where they tend to go out and walk through different parts of the graph and if you don't control that as you're going through your performance of your of your query suffers so yeah that's actually very important and you just mentioned branching factor yeah can you kind of give us a little bit more of a definition of what that means and kind of the computational overhead that comes into play yeah so branching factor is really all about the number of successors that a node has to work with so for example if in uh you know if you came to a street and there was three different ways to go that's basically a branching factor of three and if you do that many different times in a row all of a sudden you know you can quickly and easily get 256 thousand different choices and that is going to cause a tremendous amount of computational overload on your system and basically really slow down the performance of your query in your servers oh yeah that definitely can be a that can be a big problem when you were talking about this just a bit ago though you also kind of implied a little bit about the performance issues that can come into play when you're translating your data from a relational world into a graph worlds can you talk to us about some of the may be like the top three recommendations that you would have for data modelling in a graph yeah absolutely I
